intro: Poggea kamerunensis, commonly known as the Cameroon poggea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Cameroon. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth surface and a pointed tip. Poggea kamerunensis is often found in shaded, humid environments and plays a role in the ecological diversity of its native habitat.
